text:
- Hey.
- 'Hey.'

Is Rachel here?
I've got to talk to her.
No, she's out shopping.

- Damn.
- 'What's going on?'
I told Emily to come..
...and I just need to, you know
talk to Rachel about it.

Wait a minute,
so, when Emily comes

you're just, you're not
gonna see Rachel anymore?

Well, look, I'm
just trying to focus

on the I-get-to-see-my-wife
part, alright?

And not on the part
that makes me do this.

Ross, so you guys
are, you're never gonna

be in the same
room together?

How is that
even gonna work?
I have no idea. I mean..

But-but I assure you,
I-I will figure it out.

Doesn't seem like
it's going to work.

- Hi, guys.
- Hi.

- Hey.
- Hey.
What's going on?

We're flipping
Monica's mattress.

So I'm thinking, basically, we
pick it up and then we flip it.

That's better
than my way.

Oh, okay. Hey, guys,
would you flip mine too?

- Oh.
- Oh, man.
Oh, look! A letter from my mom.
So, Rach..

...you know, you know
how Emily is coming, right?
Oh, yeah, I know.

- Can you hear anything?
- Oh, yeah.

Somebody just said,
"Can you hear anything?"
Hey, Joey's ass.
What are you doing?

Well, remember when they
got in that big fight

and broke up and we
were all stuck in here

all night with no
food or anything?

Well, when Ross said
"Rachel" at the wedding

I figured it was gonna
happen again, you know?
So I hid this in here.

Ooh. Candy bars,
crossword puzzles.
Ooh, Mad Libs. Mine!
Condoms?

Hey, you don't know how
long we're gonna be in here.

We may have to
repopulate the Earth.

And condoms
are the way to do that?

Anyway, it-it kinda,
it all boils down to this.

The, the last time
I talked to Emily..

[gasps]
Oh, my God!
Our dog died.

- What?
- 'Oh, my God.'
Lapooh, our dog.
Lapooh's still alive?

Oh, it says he was hit
by an ice cream truck.

And dragged for
nine...teen blocks.

- Oh, my God.
- Sweetie, we heard you crying.
Please don't cry.

- It's Lapooh.
- I know.

It's Lapooh right now,
but it'll get better.
